title: LiveSmart Admin Dashboard
name: Name
left_blank_changed: (If left blank will not be changed)
room_info:
You can start a video conference or a broadcasting session from the buttons bellow. The organizer URL will be opened in a new tab and the visitor URL will be stored in your clipboard.
You can choose settings for the new video/broadcast from the left pane.
config_info: From this section you make changes to the configuration options of your video sessions. Please be careful when changing the options and make sure you have read here their meanings
config_server_url: Server URL <small>(needs to be like this https://domain_name:900/)</small>
config_agent_name: Agent Name <small>(if specified, it will appear in your visitor video and chat panes)</small>
config_language: Language locale <small>(you need to have the same locale files in /locales folder)</small>
config_anon_user: Anonymous user <small>(how the anonymous user appears)</small>
config_private: Private (enable only if you have specified user credentials or using password field for a room)
config_email: Show Email (enable only if you have specified user credentials or using password field for a room)
config_filename: Filename pattern. %room% will be replaced with room name and %datetime% with the current date and time
config_download: Download (recorded file is directly downloaded after video session is finished)
config_saveserver: Save on server (recorded file is saved into /server/recordings folder)
config_autostart: Auto start (recording is started on video session starts)
config_screen: Save whole screen (starts a screenshare stream and will use it as a recording)
config_oneway: One way (only visitor stream will be recorded)
config_transcode: Transcode (check here how to enable this option)
config_allowanon: Allow Anonymous (visitors are also allowed to draw on the whiteboard)
config_greenroom: Green room (pre-meeting room, where you can check your video and audio preferences)
config_conferencestyle: Conference style of video panes (it is checked by default. If not checked, only organizer of the meeting will be present in the big video pane)
config_separatescreenshare: Screen share is on separate stream (screen share session is replacing the video stream. If checked, screenshare and video will be on different streams. This may cause network outage and delay)
config_broadcastattendeevideo: Attendee in a broadcast can join with video, not only audio
config_allowothersee: Other attendees in broadcasting will see/hear the speaking attendee, not only the organizer
config_videofilestream: Video URL. If set, the broadcasting will stream from this file. Accepted format: mp4, webm, mov, ogg
config_systemmessages: System messages are shown in video panel, not in the chat
config_logs: Enable logs (enable only for debugging. Not recommended)
config_videoconstraint:
Video Constraints. For more information about the constraints check here. If you expect meeting with more participants, you can lower your camera resolution like this 
{"width": {"max": 424}, "height": {"max": 240}}
config_loginform: Login form (enable only if you have specified user credentials from the Users section, together with the Entry form)
config_roomaccess: Access only rooms in the list
config_secondlanguage: Second language (when direction is set to Both, than this option is valid for the visitor)
config_direction: Direction (defining the direction of the speech to text or translation demo)
config_apikey: API key (necessary for the translation demo. This is the Google key for translation API)
config_stunturn: STUN/TURN (for more information about STUN/TURN servers, check here)
config_encrypted: Username and password are encrypted. Please read here how to encrypt your username and password.
config_desc:
Choose a configuration from the list below. The default one is config and is loaded initially. If you need to add another configuration set, choose a name and click on Add button.
For example if you need a separate configuration with whiteboard enabled, add configuration with name config_whiteboard and click on Add button. Then you can edit it from from the left form by enabling the Whiteboard option.
Then the specific whiteboard configuration can be chosed in the Room management form.
config_localfeedmirrored: Local video feed is shown as mirrored
config_exitmeetingontime: Meeting is auto stopped on time end. This applies on scheduled meetings.
locales_info: From this section you make changes to the localizations or add a new ones.
locales_desc: Choose a locale from the list below. The default one is en_US and is loaded first. If you need to add another localization file choose a name and click on the Add button. It will copy the default en_US locale and you can edit it from the form in the left.
select_logout: Select "Logout" below if you are ready to end your current session.
broadcasting_attendee_info:
Broadcaster URL is opened in a new tab and visitor URL is stored in your clipboard, so you can send to your attendees.
You can copy it from here:
[generateBroadcastLink]
video_attendee_info:
Agent URL is opened in a new tab and visitor URL is stored in your clipboard, so you can send to your attendees.
You can copy it from here:
[generateLink]
error_config_save: Error while saving the config file.
error_config_add: Error while adding the config file.
error_locale_save: Error while saving the locale file.
error_locale_add: Error while adding the locale file.
new_lsv_version: There is a new version of LiveSmart Video Chat:
fillin_purchase_code: Please fill in your purchase code below
livesmart_not_activated: Your LiveSmart instance is not activated
livesmart_updated: Your LiveSmart is updated to the latest release
livesmart_updated_zip: Your folders are backed up in zip files, so if something is wrong you can take your old files from there.
update_location: Click here to update to the latest release
update_info:
By providing your purchase code below, you will get from our servers the latest relese of LiveSmart. The system will also do a backup of your current folders, but we recommend you also to do this manually.
If setting files like /config/config.json, /server/connect.php or /locales/en_US.json are due to update, they will not be overwritten, but added as config.json.new, connect.php.new or en_US.json.new, so you can compare and update options manually.
config_recordingconstraints: Height/Width of recorded video. For reference, you can check this graphic
